summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with a female witness, identified only by her initials, conducted on April 11, 2019. The witness describes being recruited as a teenager to give massages to Jeffrey Epstein at his West Palm Beach home, the recruitment of other minors, and the increasingly sexual nature of the encounters. She also mentions interactions with Epstein's associates and her later cooperation with law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the investigation. The witness describes being recruited to massage him at his West Palm Beach home when she was in high school, and details the sexual nature of the encounters and his requests for her to recruit other young girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as being present at Epstein's home on occasion. The witness saw her talking with another associate, Sarah, in the kitchen.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: The witness's primary contact for scheduling massages with Epstein. She called from New York, gave instructions, and provided feedback on the friends the witness brought to Epstein.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned by the witness as someone Epstein knew. Epstein told her he attended a function held by Trump and would have taken her if she was 18.

persons.name: Amanda Nicole Young
persons.context: The FBI agent who drafted the 302 report on April 17, 2019.

persons.name: Byrne Paul Wilson
persons.context: The FBI agent who drafted the 302 report on April 17, 2019.

connections.description: Sarah acted as Epstein's assistant, scheduling massage appointments with the witness and other girls, and communicating his preferences.
Maxwell was present at Epstein's West Palm Beach home, indicating a social and likely operational connection.
The witness observed Sarah and Maxwell talking together in the kitchen at Epstein's home.
Epstein told the witness he knew Trump and had attended a function Trump held.
Sarah was the witness's primary contact, calling to schedule massages and discussing which friends she could bring to Epstein.
Epstein paid the underage witness for massages that became increasingly sexual, and pressured her to perform acts she did not want to do.

events.title: Witness begins massaging Epstein
events.description: The witness, then a junior in high school, begins going to Jeffrey Epstein's West Palm Beach home for massages after being recruited by a friend.

events.title: Witness stops massaging Epstein
events.description: The witness believes she stopped going to Epstein's home around 2004 as the encounters became more sexually intense and awkward.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness is interviewed by the FBI, AUSAs, and a Task Force Officer in West Palm Beach, providing detailed information about her experiences with Epstein.

events.title: Witness contacts Palm Beach Police
events.description: After the case became news, the witness proactively contacted the Palm Beach Police Department to provide information about her experiences.

events.title: Epstein's investigators visit witness's parents
events.description: The witness believed investigators working for Epstein visited her parents' home.

locations: John I. Leonard High School (West Palm Beach, FL)
keyFacts: The witness was recruited as a high school junior (approximately 16-17 years old) to massage Jeffrey Epstein for $200 per session.
Epstein's assistant, Sarah, scheduled the appointments from New York and gave feedback on which underage friends the witness brought to Epstein.
The witness described the massages becoming increasingly sexual, with Epstein pressuring her to do things she did not want to do, leading her to stop going.
The witness kept a box of evidence including news articles, her old phone with contact numbers, journals, bank deposit records, and items taken from Epstein's home.
The witness stated it was known among girls that if you went to massage Epstein, you did not talk about it, indicating a culture of secrecy.
